channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Sharpton takes swipe at Trump at Floyd memorial: America 'never was great for blacks ... for Latinos ... for women'
The George Floyd protests are sparking a surprising debate in black America
item.description: Omar Wasow is a researcher who works in a world of charts and data. But his analytical reserve cracked after watching a video of George Floyd dying while being arrested by police.

item.title: Anderson Cooper responds to press secretary comparing Trump to Churchill
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper responds to White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany saying that President Donald Trump's photo-op in front of St. John's Episcopal Church amid the George Floyd protests was akin to Winston Churchill touring the rubble of London during WWII.

item.title: Ahmaud Arbery hit with truck before he died and killer allegedly used racial slur: testimony
item.description: William Bryan told investigators he heard Travis McMichael use a racial epithet after fatally shooting Ahmaud Arbery in Glynn County, Georgia, a Georgia Bureau of Investigation agent testified Thursday during preliminary hearings.

item.title: Why Trump's 'law and order' rhetoric may not be as effective as it was for Nixon and Reagan
Mattis' incredible excoriation of Trump, annotated
Stark contrast in what Trump and Obama said about protests
item.description: President Trump and former President Obama had very different messages when addressing the protests surrounding the death of George Floyd.

item.title: The electoral map is tilting badly against Donald Trump right now
item.description: Amid the protests following the police killing of George Floyd and the ongoing fight against the coronavirus pandemic, something very important has been overlooked: President Donald Trump is now a decided underdog to reach the 270 electoral votes he needs to win a second term in the fall.

item.title: Piers Morgan tells Rudy Giuliani on live TV: You've gone completely mad and you sound deranged
item.description: Piers Morgan's live interview with Rudy Giuliani on Thursday devolved into a heated argument, that at times turned very personal, on ITV's "Good Morning Britain."

item.title: K-pop fans drown out anti-black hashtags with memes and videos
item.description: If there's one rule on social media that people can agree on, it's this: Don't cross K-pop stans. With tens of thousands of K-pop fan accounts posting over six billion tweets last year, they have become one of the strongest forces on social media.

item.title: Kanye West donates $2 million, pays college tuition for George Floyd's daughter
item.description: Kanye West has made a $2 million donation to support the families of George Floyd, Ahmaud Arbrery, and Breonna Taylor, along with black-owned businesses in crisis in his native Chicago, a representative for West told CNN.

item.title: Video captures police officer in Florida kneeling on a black man's neck during an arrest
item.description: A Florida police department has launched an internal investigation after a video surfaced on social media showing a Sarasota police officer kneeling on a black man's neck during an arrest.

item.title: Hydroxychlororquine study on Covid-19 patients retracted
US billionaires have become $565 billion richer during the pandemic
item.description: The past three months have been financially painful for many Americans -- but not for billionaires.

item.title: Experts fear this country could suffer one of the world's worst coronavirus outbreaks
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Yemenis face what experts fear could be one of the world's worst coronavirus outbreaks, raising concerns of a staggering death toll after the United Nations began cutting aid to the war-torn nation.

item.title: Thousands of Hong Kongers defy police ban to remember Tiananmen Square
item.description: Thousands of Hong Kongers defied a police ban Thursday to gather in the city's Victoria Park and mark the 31st anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre.

item.title: 'Wolf pack' members given further prison terms over separate sexual assault
item.description: Four of the Spanish men convicted in 2019 of raping a woman in Pamplona have been sentenced to further prison terms for a separate case of sexual abuse that occurred months earlier.

item.title: The history of the secret White House presidential bunker
item.description: President Donald Trump was briefly taken to a White House bunker on Friday night as protesters demonstrated across the street, and while the annex of bunkers and tunnels under the White House are nothing new, they're rarely used by American presidents.

item.title: German prosecutors assume Madeleine McCann is dead
item.description: The parents of missing British girl Madeleine McCann believe the police announcement of a new suspect is potentially a "very significant" development in the case.

item.title: Village underwater since 1994 could resurface
item.description: A 12th century Italian village submerged underwater for more than 25 years could soon see the light of day again.

item.title: India says there have been 'significant' Chinese troop movements amid border tensions
item.description: Chinese troops have moved into a tense, disputed section of the Himalayan border shared by China and India, according to a high-ranking Delhi official.

item.title: US Navy veteran detained in Iran has been released
item.description: Michael White, an American detained in Iran, was released on Thursday after more than a year in custody.

item.title: Stars back John Boyega following rousing Black Lives Matter speech
'Star Wars' actor John Boyega rallies crowd at protest
item.description: "Star Wars" actor John Boyega rallied crowds at a large London protest against George Floyd's death, telling demonstrators that "now is the time" to demand racial equality.

item.title: Lance Armstrong: The man who 'gained the world but lost his soul'
item.description: Betsy Andreu is frustrated. She's just watched the first two hours of Lance Armstrong sharing what the disgraced cyclist calls "his truth" in ESPN's recent 30-for-30 documentary. She isn't buying it.

item.title: Mark Cuban was seriously weighing a run for US president last month
item.description: In the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, while many people were learning how to bake sourdough or plant a garden, Mark Cuban was considering a run for president. He even hired a pollster.

item.title: Elephant dies after suspected firecrackers hidden in fruit exploded in her mouth
item.description: The death of a pregnant wild elephant, suspected to have been fatally injured after eating fruit stuffed with firecrackers that exploded in her mouth, has stirred public outrage in India as authorities investigate the incident.

item.title: Attorney General explains why it's hard to convict police officers
item.description: Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison explains why his office did not charge the former Minneapolis Police officer who pressed his knee into George Floyd's neck with first-degree murder and why it's difficult to convict police officers.

item.title: 37 children injured in a knife attack at elementary school
item.description: An attacker with a knife injured 37 children and two adults at an elementary school in southern China on Thursday, according to a local government statement.

item.title: In India's remote villages, going hungry is as big a fear as catching the coronavirus
item.description: Bheru Singh lives in Dechu, a desert village in the far west of Rajasthan in India, where summer temperatures rise as high as 50 degrees Celsius (122 degrees Fahrenheit).

item.title: New Zealand to provide free sanitary products in schools
item.description: The New Zealand government said Wednesday that it will provide free sanitary products in schools across the country in an effort to tackle period poverty -- where girls or women are unable to afford or access sufficient menstrual hygiene products.

item.title: Internet mocks Trump's Bible photo-op
item.description: Twitter users and comics can't stop roasting Trump for brandishing the Bible. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: India's cyclone response saves lives. Climate resilient infrastructure will save livelihoods
item.description: Mumbai avoided the worst of Cyclone Nisarga, which made landfall close to the Indian financial capital in western Maharashtra state on Wednesday, but caused minimal damage, officials said.

item.title: Joe Exotic says Carole Baskin getting his zoo is a 'treachery'
item.description: In response to the lawsuit that awarded Carole Baskin the zoo once owned by Joe Exotic, the "Tiger King's" management team released a statement that said Baskin's "treachery" has to be challenged.

item.title: Has the UK just canceled summer?
item.description: Across Europe, beaches are getting ready for their first socially distanced foreign visitors, hotels are airing out rooms and restaurants are laying alfresco tables. With borders now open, the travel industry is trying to salvage as much of the peak tourist season as possible.

item.title: Thousands of aviation jobs have gone already. The shock wave puts many more at risk
item.description: The fallout from the coronavirus pandemic has gutted airlines and is now spreading to companies that make the parts and systems powering their planes, threatening to devastate a highly skilled workforce and hamstring the industry's eventual recovery.

item.title: Why are these giant teddy bears riding a roller coaster?
item.description: An amusement park in the Netherlands, closed at the time because of the pandemic, filled a roller coaster with giant teddy bears.

item.title: 'Skin is a terrain': Powerful new works from Nigerian-American artist Toyin Ojih Odutola
item.description: Nigerian-American artist Toyin Ojih Odutola is known for her rich, textural portraits of black life, layered through intricate ballpoint pen, charcoal and pastel.

item.title: How lavender became a symbol of LGBTQ resistance
item.description: Every year, as summer beckons, Pride month arrives in a burst of color. Around the world, rainbow flags fly high and revelers turn their faces proudly towards the sky.

item.title: Astronomers confirm Earth-size exoplanet around nearest star and maybe more
item.description: Astronomers have confirmed the existence of Proxima b, an Earth-size exoplanet orbiting the closest star to our sun.

item.title: 'I demand change now,' says tennis star Coco Gauff in powerful speech to protesters
item.description: US tennis sensation Coco Gauff has urged people to speak out on the issue of racial injustice as she promised to continue using her platform to fight for change.

item.title: Bayern Munich planning to join George Floyd protests
item.description: Bayern Munich star Joshua Kimmich says the club is planning on joining the protests against George Floyd's death and believes white players should stand with their black teammates in showing solidarity.

item.title: TV host pleads with National Guard to join protest
item.description: Daytime host Keke Palmer spoke to National Guard members at the Hollywood protests following George Floyd's death. Palmer pleaded with them to march with protesters and they compromised by taking a knee.

item.title: Sharpton gives impassioned eulogy: US kept 'knee on our neck'
item.description: The Rev. Al Sharpton denounced racism and called for accountability in the criminal justice system as he delivered an eulogy Thursday for George Floyd.

item.title: Floyd's brother shares what it was like growing up with George
item.description: Philonise Floyd, the brother of George Floyd, shares some of his childhood memories at his brother's memorial service in Minneapolis.

item.title: White House fortifies security perimeter ahead of more protests
item.description: The People's House continued to be fortified from the public Thursday, as workers erected a perimeter of tall metal fencing around the White House complex.

item.title: Mattis' incredible excoriation of Trump, annotated
item.description: President Donald Trump's first secretary of defense, retired Marine Gen. James Mattis, said in a remarkable 650-word statement to The Atlantic on Wednesday that the President is actively trying to divide the country and urged Americans to unite without him.

item.title: Diplomats fear blow to US moral authority
item.description: Less than 24 hours after law enforcement officials violently dispersed peaceful protesters outside the White House with pepper balls and rubber bullets, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo met with survivors of China's brutal 1989 crackdown on the pro-democracy protesters in Tiananmen Square.

item.title: Hydroxychloroquine study retracted
Retired general: I was horrified watching Trump's photo op
item.description: General John Allen, former commander of US forces in Afghanistan, criticizes President Trump and his actions following the death of George Floyd.
